Create a detailed menu: Plan a menu that includes all the traditional dishes for the holiday dinner, as well as any dietary restrictions or preferences of the family members. This will help you to prepare the meal efficiently and effectively.
Shop smart: Make a list of all the ingredients you need for the meal and buy them in bulk to save time and money. Look for deals and discounts to get the best prices.

Prep ahead of time: Prepare as much as you can ahead of time to reduce the amount of work on the day of the dinner. This can include chopping vegetables, marinating meats, and making sauces or dressings.
Use a slow cooker: A slow cooker is a great way to cook a large roast or other slow-cooked dishes. You can add the ingredients, set the timer, and forget about it until the meal is ready.

Hire a caterer: If you don't have the time or resources to prepare the meal yourself, consider hiring a caterer. They can take care of all the details, from shopping to cooking to serving, and you can focus on enjoying the holiday with your family.
